title: In Occupation's Shadow
opening: After defeating the bandits, Lyn continues westward. She and her colleagues stop for the night at a ruined fortress. The Ganelon bandits are in a rage after their brethren fell to Lyn’s swords. They race in pursuit of the companions. Their angry footsteps sound closer and closer…

intro.speaker: Wil
intro.line: Ah, this should suffice! Tonight’s bed!

intro.speaker: Sain
intro.line: This mildewy old fortress? Is this the best we can do? Come, Wil! Surely you jest!

intro.speaker: Wil
intro.line: The bandits keep everything in turmoil around here. No one has time to worry about travelers. And there are rather a lot of us.

intro.speaker: Lyn
intro.line: This will be fine. Who wants to be stuck inside, anyway? I prefer a place where I can feel the wind blow.

intro.speaker: Florina
intro.line: As long as I’m at Lyn’s side, I’ll be fine.

intro.speaker: Sain
intro.line: And for your protection, your man-at-arms Sain will be right here by your side, ladies.

intro.speaker: Kent
intro.line: Sain, both you and I are to remain awake. We will alternate the watch.

intro.speaker: Sain
intro.line: Ah, alas...

intro.speaker: Unknown
intro.line: Your pardon, milady...

intro.speaker: Lyn
intro.line: Who’s there?

intro.speaker: Natalie
intro.line: I...Forgive my intrusion...My name’s Natalie. I’m from a village not far from here...Ah! Ow...

intro.speaker: Lyn
intro.line: Are you all right?

intro.speaker: Natalie
intro.line: Hm?

intro.speaker: Lyn
intro.line: Your leg...

intro.speaker: Natalie
intro.line: It’s fine. Don’t worry. It’s from a childhood sickness...I can’t travel far on it, but it doesn’t trouble me much.

intro.speaker: Lyn
intro.line: What are you doing here all by yourself?

intro.speaker: Natalie
intro.line: I’m looking for my husband...I heard he was in this area. He said he was going to raise money to have my leg mended. He left the village and hasn’t returned. He’s a kindhearted man, but I think he might be involved in something dangerous. I got so worried...Here’s a sketch of him. It’s a poor likeness at best, but...His name is Dorcas. Do you know of him?

intro.speaker: Lyn
intro.line: I’m sorry. I don’t believe I’ve seen or heard of him.

intro.speaker: Natalie
intro.line: I see...If you do meet him, please give him a message. Tell him that Natalie is looking for him.

intro.speaker: Lyn
intro.line: I will tell him. I promise.

intro.speaker: Carjiga
intro.line: Here they are. We’ve finally tracked down the band that defeated Migal.

intro.speaker: Ratface
intro.line: So they’ve decided to hole up in this ruined fortress. Perfect. We’ll wait ’til it gets dark, and then...

intro.speaker: Carjiga
intro.line: You’re an idiot! There are only a few of them, and some are women! If we attacked them at night, I’d be a laughingstock! Besides, we might hurt the women by mistake! I will not be so wasteful!

intro.speaker: Ratface
intro.line: You’re right, Carjiga! You’re so smart!

intro.speaker: Carjiga
intro.line: We’ll avenge Migal and get some pretty souvenirs to boot. Who knows, maybe I’ll be a leader after all. Ha ha ha! Let’s go! Spread out and encircle the place, you rogues! Let’s finish this before it gets too dark to see!

intro.speaker: Carjiga
intro.line: Hey, you! Your name’s...Dorcas, right?

intro.speaker: Carjiga
intro.line: You haven’t done much since you joined us. If those weapons of yours aren’t just for show, today’s the day to let us see what you can do.

intro.speaker: Carjiga
intro.line: I want you to attack from the back entrance to the east. There’s supposed to be a woman inside. I want you to capture her. Do that, and I’ll increase your share of the take. If you want gold, you’ll get the job done.

intro.speaker: Dorcas
intro.line: A bunch of women, huh? It would break Natalie’s sweet heart to see me sink so low.

intro.speaker: Kent
intro.line: Lady Lyndis! Outside the fortress! Bandits!

intro.speaker: Lyn
intro.line: What did you say?

intro.speaker: Sain
intro.line: Persistent bunch, aren’t they? What do you think? Shall we go out and face them?

intro.speaker: Lyn
intro.line: No... Natalie cannot move well, and that would put her in danger. Let them come to us. We’ll fight here, within these walls.

intro.speaker: Lyn
intro.line: Mark, take over. The command is yours. All we have to do is hold out until they tire and leave.

intro.speaker: Natalie
intro.line: Oh...

intro.speaker: Lyn
intro.line: Rest easy, Natalie. No one will harm you! Listen, everyone! Fight with caution!

battle.speaker: Dorcas
battle.line: So you're their tactician... I'll use my axes and fight alongside you. Direct me as you will.

battle.speaker: Tutorial
battle.line: The weapon Dorcas is using is called a handaxe. Use it to attack an adjacent opponent, or throw it in indirect combat in the manner of a bow. This versatility makes it a valuable weapon.

battle.speaker: Tutorial
battle.line: Right now, after all of your units have moved, it automatically becomes the enemy's turn, right? Sometimes, there are moments when you might not want or be able to move all of your units. When it's bothersome to tell your units to wait one by one, select end from the map menu to speed things up. To display the map menu, place the cursor on an unoccupied space and press the A Button.

battle.speaker: Carjiga
battle.line: What are you waiting for? She's just a child! A girl! Grrr! Get more men up here now!!

battle.speaker: Lyn
battle.line: I wasn't strong enough... ...I couldn't protect Natalie. I'm sorry Tactician... I need to be alone. ...I... I failed her when she needed help most.

recruit-talk.speaker: Lyn
recruit-talk.line: You! Tell me, are you Dorcas?

recruit-talk.speaker: Dorcas
recruit-talk.line: ..... How do you know my name?

recruit-talk.speaker: Lyn
recruit-talk.line: Natalie told me. What are you doing with these rogues?

recruit-talk.speaker: Lyn
recruit-talk.line: That may be, but...joining up with mercenaries?

recruit-talk.speaker: Dorcas
recruit-talk.line: It's the only way to earn gold in these parts. I'll do anything...even this.

recruit-talk.speaker: Lyn
recruit-talk.line: For gold? Anything? Would you hurt your wife? Natalie is here! We're protecting her within this fortress!!

recruit-talk.speaker: Lyn
recruit-talk.line: She was so worried that she came looking for you. Think, Dorcas! Would your actions please your wife?

recruit-talk.speaker: Dorcas
recruit-talk.line: I understand. I can't do this. I'm done with these bandits. Here and now.

recruit-talk.speaker: Dorcas
recruit-talk.line: Yes... And I would repay you for your kindness toward Natalie. Allow me to fight for you.

recruit-talk.speaker: Tutorial
recruit-talk.line: In this way, you can sometimes turn enemies into allies. Never underestimate the persuasive power of speech. Your new companion, Dorcas, is an axe-wielding fighter. Do you remember the weapon triangle? Axes are strong against lances and weak against swords. Axes have more power than other weapons, but they are also more difficult to hit with. Try using Dorcas to attack. Select Dorcas now.

battle-talk.speaker: Dorcas
battle-talk.line: Natalie! Are you all right? What were you thinking, coming out all this way?

battle-talk.speaker: Natalie
battle-talk.line: I was worried about you. Please, don't let my leg trouble you anymore. You mustn't put yourself in such danger. Please!

battle-talk.speaker: Dorcas
battle-talk.line: I'm sorry. I must have been out of my head. I didn't realize... That girl Lyn made me open my eyes.

battle-talk.speaker: Dorcas
battle-talk.line: I'll explain later. We've got to drive back these bandits first. Listen, stay put. Don't move from here.

battle-talk.speaker: Natalie
battle-talk.line: All right. As long as you're here, I know I'm safe.

boss.speaker: Carjiga
boss.line: Urgh! How? How are they so tough? You! Bring me more men here right away!

end.speaker: Lyn
end.line: The enemy's fled... Tactician! We've won!!!

end.speaker: Natalie
end.line: Dorcas!

end.speaker: Dorcas
end.line: I'm so sorry, Natalie.

end.speaker: Lyn
end.line: All's well that ends well. Right, Natalie?

end.speaker: Dorcas
end.line: Our village is close. I'll take Natalie home and return tomorrow.

end.speaker: Lyn
end.line: Hm? Why can't we just say our farewells today?

end.speaker: Dorcas
end.line: Well, I... I spoke with Tactician. I... I've been invited to join your group.

end.speaker: Lyn
end.line: But we're going to Lycia.

end.speaker: Dorcas
end.line: I have to go somewhere to earn money. If you think I'll be of use, I'd like to fight for you. You helped my wife... I owe you.

end.speaker: Lyn
end.line: Dorcas...

end.speaker: Natalie
end.line: Please, Lyn. We are both in agreement on this. Watch over my husband.

end.speaker: Lyn
end.line: Things have finally calmed down.

end.speaker: Kent
end.line: We shall take turns keeping watch. Please rest easily.

end.speaker: Lyn
end.line: Is that all right? Are you sure? Sain!

end.speaker: Sain
end.line: Ye-Yes! Of course!

end.speaker: Lyn
end.line: Let me warn you... If bandits sneak up on you, they will cut you down without mercy. Do you understand that?

end.speaker: Sain
end.line: What are you saying? Am I not a knight? There's no need to worry so! Right, Kent?

end.speaker: Kent
end.line: If there's anything suspicious, I will take care of it. Please be assured.

end.speaker: Lyn
end.line: Really? Well, goodnight then. See you tomorrow, Tactician.

end.speaker: Kent
end.line: Let's go.

end.speaker: Sain
end.line: Ha ha... No one trusts me...
